Men belonging to the SelfDefense Council of Michoacan CAM engage in a firefight while trying to flush out alleged members of the Knights Templar drug cartel from Nueva Italia Mexico Sunday Jan PERIOD   PERIOD The vigilantes say they are liberating territory in the socalled Tierra Caliente and are aiming for the farming hub of Apatzingan said to be the cartels central command PERIOD Mexican military troops are staying outside the town and there are no federal police in sight PERIOD AP PhotoEduardo Verdugo

NUEVA ITALIA Mexico AP  Gunfire erupted Sunday in western Mexico as hundreds of vigilantes pressed their fight over territory with a drug cartel and Mexicos top security officials prepared to make yet another effort to try to stop the violence PERIOD

Members of socalled selfdefense groups entered the town of Nueva Italia in Michoacan state on a campaign they say is designed to liberate towns from the control of the Knights Templar cartel PERIOD Opponents and critics say the vigilantes are backed by a rival cartel something the groups vehemently deny PERIOD

State Gov PERIOD Fausto Vallejo gave a brief statement Sunday saying he had formally asked the federal government for more help to quell the violence PERIOD He announced a meeting Monday in the capital to lay out a strategy to reclaim the peace PERIOD

Hundreds of vigilantes drove into Nueva Italia late Sunday morning in a caravan of large trucks then surrounded the city hall and disarmed local police PERIOD An Associated Press journalist witnessed citizens initially welcoming them PERIOD

But shooting broke out almost immediately in and around the center square PERIOD Only one injury was reported by midday PERIOD

Gunfire could be heard around the city PERIOD Vallejo acknowledged violence has gone on for four days as vigilantes appeared to be advancing and surrounding the farming hub of Apatzingan which is said to be the Knights Templars central command PERIOD

Vallejo said he formally asked Interior Minister Miguel Angel Osorio Chong on Friday for more federal forces 

The selfdefense groups claim local and state police are in the employ of the Knights Templar PERIOD

Fighting between vigilantes and alleged cartel members has racked Michoacan for almost a year PERIOD President Enrique Pena Nietos government already has sent thousands of federal police officers and soldiers to the state but the situation has only worsened PERIOD

Both federal police and soldiers were seen near Nueva Italia on Sunday but didnt intervene in the fighting PERIOD

The federal government has said the civilian vigilante groups are operating outside the law PERIOD They carry highcaliber weapons that Mexico only allows for military use PERIOD But government forces have not moved against them and in some cases seem to be working in concert with the vigilantes PERIOD

Rumors circulate that some selfdefense groups have been infiltrated by the New Generation cartel which is reportedly fighting a turf war with the Knights Templar in the rich farming state that is a major exporter of limes avocados and mangos PERIOD

Some in the region say members of the Knights Templar have also tried to use selfdefense groups as cover for illegal activities PERIOD

The U.S PERIOD State Department issued a travel warning for Mexico on Thursday recommending against travel in Michoacan with the exception of the state capital Morelia and the port city of Lazaro Cardenas and in those cases only by air PERIOD
